programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim Carver is in a quandary after turning down Marie's proposal of marriage - could the imminent return of his old flame June Ackland have anything to do with his decision? Luckily, dizzy PC Honey Harman is on hand with her astrology book to give the confused copper a spot of romantic advice. Meanwhile, Danny Glaze finds himself in a terrifying situation as he hunts for missing teenager Nathan - the brother of gun-toting local rogue Prince - and Des Taviner interviews a witness who seems more interested in speaking to the scouse PC's superior, Sgt Sheelagh Murphy

programme.title: Classic EastEnders

programme.title: Classic EastEnders

programme.title: Tenko
programme.desc: Unexpected news means a sudden change of plan for Maggie and Mrs Van Meyer. Alice sets sail for England, while Christina resolves to stay in Singapore and become a teacher. Second World War drama starring Stephanie Cole and Lizzie Mickery

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The Greek Orthodox Church challenges the ownership of Lord Dunwich's valuable 17th-century communion vessel, and the dodgy dealer is called in to investigate. Comedy drama, directed by and starring Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Joanna's life hangs in the balance as she's held at knifepoint by a runaway mother with a dark secret. Some good news lifts Sam's depression over the death of a patient and romance blossoms between Andrew and receptionist Dawn. Another slice of rural medical life, starring Gary Mavers, Haydn Gwynne and Joseph Millson

programme.title: May to December
programme.desc: Alec chooses to say it with flowers after a communication breakdown, and Vera is nervous about her imminent wedding. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers

programme.title: Just Good Friends
programme.desc: Already preoccupied with the possibility that she might be pregnant, Penny also has to deal with the prospect of dinner with Vince's parents. After receiving the results of the test, both of the mismatched lovers claim to be pleased. Comedy, starring Paul Nicholas and Jan Francis

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg, Truly and Billy offer words of wisdom to a broken-hearted man they find seeking solace in the woods. Peter Sallis and Hywel Bennett star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: A hang-gliding enthusiast crashes down in the village, mistakenly believing that he's landed in France, thus breaking the long-distance record. The gang tries to compensate for his disappointment by making him the best at something else - identifying a strange cat creature lurking in the woods. Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy star

programme.title: The Last Detective
programme.desc: Dangerous investigates the disappearance of a man whose wife seems strangely unconcerned about his whereabouts, and two ballroom-dancing regulars discover a tragic secret. Julia McKenzie and Sian Phillips guest star, with Peter Davison and Sean Hughes

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A 79-year-old woman with dementia runs away from her care home and turns up at a south London police station to report a murder - sparking a reinvestigation into the mysterious disappearance of her police officer husband in 1956. The official report says that he fell into the river after one too many beers - but what secrets was this seemingly straight-as-a die old-fashioned bobby keeping? Meanwhile, Steve's son is arrested for buying weed, bringing the retired cop face to face with his ex-wife - a woman he hasn't seen in 10 years. Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson star, with a guest appearance from Julie Graham

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sasha is forced to work with her ex-husband Ned Hancock when their teams investigate the death of film critic Oliver Houghton, whose body was discovered floating in the Thames. UCOS delves into the victim's past and explores his link to the murder of a conceptual artist 20 years previously, while Hancock's knowledge of London's hidden past proves invaluable when a piece of occult footage from the 1970s plunges the investigators into the macabre world of human sacrifice. Tamzin Outhwaite and Denis Lawson star, with a guest appearance by Barnaby Kay

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A police cadet's body is found, and it soon transpires that his demise mirrors the death of another murder victim killed months previously. When Sam Ryan and her forensic team investigate, they discover the dead man's training college could prove vital in solving the crime. Acclaimed drama series, starring Amanda Burton, with a guest appearance by Tim Healy

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Max wrestles with the after-effects of neurosurgery and the financial pressure on the hospital, but things get worse when an encounter with an old enemy puts a strain on her relationship with Louis. Kian brings in some new recruits to help solve Jac's medical mystery, and a new arrival stirs up unpleasant memories for Donna

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: As far as dapper gent Jackie is concerned, the 1967 Sexual Offences Act may not be as revolutionary as it appears. Monologue delivered by Ian Gelder. Written by Matthew Baldwin

programme.title: Queers
programme.desc: As the Blitz hits London, Fredrick is grateful he survived in a very unlikely place of refuge. Monologue delivered by Kadiff Kirwan. Written by Keith Jarrett

programme.title: Queers

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gemma Osbourne's loyalties are divided when she and Kerry Young are called to a dispute at a refuge where immigration officials are trying to extract a woman and child facing deportation. Eva Sharpe returns to work, but Phil Hunter doubts whether she's still up to the job as they investigate an alleged assault at a slick law firm, and June Ackland spies a wedding ring in Jim Carver's desk drawer _ is this going to be her lucky day?

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Alfie is forced to face up to his feelings. Sharon convinces Dennis to do the right thing and Phil plans his revenge

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian discovers who played dirty in the chippy as Phil gives him a warning to remember. Nana's confused attempts at matchmaking give Alfie a lucky escape

programme.title: Tenko
programme.desc: The women confront mixed feelings as they prepare for their long-awaited journey home and agree to a reunion in five years' time. Sister Ulrica visits Yamauchi in prison, and Bea decides to stay on in Singapore. Second World War drama, starring Claire Oberman and Stephanie Cole

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Tinker is arrested for possessing erotic antiques and tries to wriggle out of it by implicating Lovejoy in a robbery. Meanwhile, Charlotte gets involved with a dodgy pawnbroker whose auction of unclaimed property contains some very choice lots indeed. Starring Ian McShane, Dudley Sutton and Caroline Langrishe

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Dawn fears her breast cancer might return, and Joanna regrets her reaction to a patient's request for cosmetic surgery, while plucky local copper Pete Greenhalgh faces an adversary even his courage can't protect him from - a potentially fatal brain condition. Rural medical drama, starring Gary Mavers, Haydn Gwynne and Nick Stringer

programme.title: May to December
programme.desc: Zoe decides on a water birth, while Alec jumps at the chance to emulate his hero Perry Mason

programme.title: Just Good Friends
programme.desc: On the day Penny's divorce finally comes through, she receives a marriage proposal. Romantic comedy, starring Paul Nicholas and Jan Francis

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly and Clegg are enlightened in the wisdom of the East by an electrical handyman from Hull, and Howard struggles to keep his self-styled bandit persona alive. Meanwhile, a debt-collector is an unwelcome guest for Tom

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: After helping Entwistle repair his truck, Truly, Clegg and Billy find their mechanical skills are put to the test once more when they help Tom and Smiler locate the source of an irritating squeak on their handcart. However, when Barry's longed-for game of golf evaporates thanks to his borrowed car breaking down, all the trio can do is help him drown his sorrows

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Convicted murderer Charlie Walker seizes his chance to escape while in transit across the moors. The next morning a barmaid is discovered dead - leaving the duo to figure out whether she was killed by the fugitive. Tim Healy and Lynda Bellingham guest star

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The discovery of a Roman sword with traces of blood on it is linked to an unidentified, headless corpse found near Heathrow in March 2008. It leads the team members to a lock-up belonging to a bodybuilder called Mark Rix, who died of a suspected heart attack the same year, so they start looking for connections between the original murder and Rix's death. They are helped in their investigation by anthropologist Fiona Kennedy, for whom Dan begins to develop feelings - just as he is told his wife might be discharged from the secure hospital where she has spent the past several years. Tracy-Ann Obermann and Liz White guest star

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: When a government minister is killed by a fire in a London hotel, terrorists are suspected of starting the blaze _ until Leo discovers a wad of notes on the MP's bed. Forensic pathologist Sam Ryan tries to uncover the truth, but finds her investigations are hampered by a former schoolfriend who claims to work for the Cabinet Office. Amanda Burton and William Gaminara star

programme.title: Gentleman Jack
programme.desc: Historical drama by Sally Wainwright, starring Suranne Jones, based on the true story of controversial 19th-century landowner Anne Lister. In 1832, Anne returns to her family home in Halifax following the end of her relationship with aristocratic lover Vere. Struggling to live with her father and sister, she finds a welcome distraction in transforming her family's coal-rich land - while a visit from another old flame feeds her fears that she is destined to be alone. With Timothy West and Gemma Whelan

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Chloe and Cameron are driven further apart when they end up competing for the same job - and tension rises even further when Cameron deliberately sabotages his rival's chances. Sacha and Jodie band together after their explosive domestic outburst

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Panic breaks out when hospital gossip suggests a Royal visit may be imminent, and Charlie curses Duffy's absence, unaware she has been the victim of an attack

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gemma Osbourne shows everyone her nasty side as she continues her stand against the immigration officials, prompting Superintendent Okaro to doubt her suitability as an officer _ and leading to a confrontation between the aggrieved PC and her no-nonsense superior Gina Gold. Eva Sharpe continues her investigation into the law-firm assault _ even when the alleged victim drops the charges _ while on the personal front, June Ackland struggles to hide her loneliness as Jim and Marie celebrate their engagement _ until an equally lovelorn colleague steps into the breach

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sonia gets a surprise on her first birthday without Jamie

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Dot shocks Sonia, Alfie tries to cope with the aftermath of Kat's date and Spencer finally secures the deal of a lifetime

programme.title: Tenko
programme.desc: Part one of two. Five years after their release, the women decide to meet in Singapore - unaware of the intrigue that awaits them

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Finding himself in dire financial straits, Lovejoy borrows 100,000 from a loan shark using his daughter Viki's flat as security. Unfortunately the deal backfires, and he's forced to use every ounce of his ingenuity to ensure they both emerge unscathed. Frank Finlay guest stars, with Ian McShane

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Clare Shearer returns to Cardale, still fuming over the way Andrew kept her in the dark about David's affair, and wastes no time in claiming her share of the Beeches. Meanwhile, Joanna tries to make peace between a terminally ill woman and her daughter, but fears the rift may be too deep to heal. Medical drama, starring Gary Mavers and Fiona Gillies

programme.title: May to December
programme.desc: Zoe longs for Alec to return to work so she can be alone with the baby. Comedy, starring Anton Rodgers

programme.title: Just Good Friends
programme.desc: Vince and Penny meet in Paris after a two-year separation. Bittersweet comedy, starring Paul Nicholas and Jan Francis

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: In the hope of avoiding a fuss, Clegg plans a quiet birthday lunch at a nice hotel - but his pals are sure to throw a few spanners in the works. Long-running comedy set in Yorkshire, from the pen of Roy Clarke. Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton star

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: After seeing a man skiing on a van roof, the pals are intrigued to discover it is Gavin Hinchcliffe, an old friend renowned for his eccentricity. Comedy series, guest starring Bernard Cribbins, with Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Josephine Tewson

programme.title: Kingdom
programme.desc: Angela and Tony Forshaw want to sue for damages when their daughter Laura is refused a place at Cambridge. Peter discovers why Gloria and her son Scott are acting strangely, and Snell takes on the gas company when they threaten to build on sheep-grazing land. Meanwhile, more information comes to light about Simon's lifestyle

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: Jane and Davey investigate when the patriarch of a local aristocratic family is found stabbed to death, but find themselves revisiting an embarrassing chapter of their teenage romance. Crime drama, Starring Claire Goose

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The arrest of a Turkish girl who has been working illegally leads Ucos to reopen the case of Richard Gibson, a pub landlord who died in a fire in 2009. The original investigation concluded Gibson's death was probably suicide due to his dire financial situation, but the detectives have some questions about the pub's live-in barmaid, who disappeared on the night of the blaze. Could widowed landlady Joanne, pub regular Jason, or the dead man's best friend David, who happens to have a sideline in passing off his British-produced sparkling wine as French champagne, supply them with any answers? While the case tests the team's brain power, Sasha is also keen to raise their fitness levels as she signs them up for a five-a-side football competition. Phil Davis, Niamh Cusack and Tom Georgeson guest star

programme.title: Silent Witness

Things are tense with the Panesars and Eve and Suki find their chance to get rid of Nish for good

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. Now, there's growing evidence suggesting this could be linked to the food we eat. Ultra-processed convenience foods contain chemicals that UK regulators say are safe, but Panorama investigates emerging scientific evidence of a link between some of these chemicals and cancer, diabetes, and strokes

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and YouTuber Jim Browning join forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc: Paul insists on having Kappen's body exhumed. Jackie reluctantly allows it, but warns him that a wrong step could fatally compromise the force's reputation. At a press conference discussing the exhumation, questions are raised about the line of enquiry regarding Willoughby, and why more is not being done to eliminate other suspects first. Paul nonetheless puts all his efforts into following the Kappen theory, forcing Phil and Geraint to take matters into their own hands

Keanu is stunned to discover Sharon bought the Arches for him and he admits he is finding it difficult knowing that she is the one supporting him

Myles causes problems for Joe who is already reeling from an unexpected visitor, leaving him and Mike feeling uncertain about the future

programme.title: Steeltown Murders: Hunting a Serial Killer
programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. With revealing interviews from detectives at the heart of the re-investigation and emotional first-time interviews from friends and family of the girls, the programme reveals how, after nearly 30 years, Wales's first serial killer was finally unmasked

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: When Thorfinn's bones are discovered on the property, he asks Sam to conduct the traditional Viking funeral he's always wanted, but Sam and Jay are torn when they learn that the bones could be sold to a museum for a lot of much-needed cash

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Sam and Jay invite Henry and Margaret to a dinner party to woo them into allowing the bed and breakfast, and the ghosts are desperately eager to be included on the guest list

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc: In Somerset, Sarah Moore explores Keynsham Recycling Centre, searching for three items she hopes can be revived. There's a cast iron mangle for woodworker Bruce Faulseit and upholsterer Leigh-Anne Treadwell sets to work trying to give a much-cherished chair a second chance. Sarah herself has a metal bed frame to repurpose

programme.desc: Jules Hudson is in the Welsh county of Powys with a couple whose wish list includes an annexe for their parents, along with at least half an acre of land for their budget of 650,000. Jules also meets a man who scours space with his telescopes, looking for large, undiscovered objects that could be on a collision course with Earth

programme.desc: Suki sets her plan to take down Nish into action and Linda is determined to find some dirt on George. Sharon worries about Keanu's business skills so she hires Reiss to take care of the Arches accounts. Ben and Jay finally get Lexi to open up

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team welcome the Poet Laureate Simon Armitage into the Repair Shop who brings with him a harmonium, the subject of one of his poems that brings back memories of his late father. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. Finally, Kirsty visits jeweller Richard Talman, hoping he can fix her mum's silver charm bracelet gifted to her mother by her father in the early 1960s

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: The third kiss-off ends with a bang, as Dannii Minogue asks the couples to make their toughest choice yet - whether their relationships can survive outside the show. For one pairing, this represents a particular challenge, as they live a great distance from each other

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: The boys decide if they want to take their relationship into the real world - but not before one final party where everyone dresses up as their favourite queer icon. On the final day, family and friends come to visit, which leaves some of the boys with the unique experience of introducing them to a partner for the first time

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Debra from Wigan, Greater Manchester, wants her new build plot to be transformed into a calming zen garden for relaxation and contemplation. She'd also like it to be low maintenance and maximise the views from the woodland beyond. Charlie Dimmock and Lee Burkhill try to bring her vision to life on a budget of 6,000

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Costume designer Ploy's three-story home is bursting at the seams with designs spilling into every room, preventing her from getting a good night's sleep. ostume designer Ploy's three-story home is bursting at the seams with designs spilling into every room, preventing her from getting a good night's sleep. DIY legend Tommy Walsh, expert cleaner Maxine Dwyer and carpenter Asher Edwards have just 24 hours on a limited budget to organise her space, create a bespoke craft area, and clear the chaos from the conservatory

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Edith Bowman visit the National Ploughing Championships in Derbyshire on a food adventure, where they discover the story behind the Bakewell tart and are let loose on tractors. Farmer Meinir Howells reveals the secrets of one of the UK's oldest ice-cream parlours, Ryan Hand finds out the superpowers of seeds, and farmer Jim Smith learns the art of pickling

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Interior designer Banjo Beale is pushed out of his comfort zone when the Isle of Mull Rugby Club hire him to redesign their dated bar. The members are keen to reflect the club's rich history, but with a large space to fill and little knowledge of sport, Banjo admits it's a challenging task to undertake

programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers bike from north to south through Europe, searching for the best baking each country has to offer. They start their 5,000-mile trek in Norway, picking up tips and recipes from professionals and home bakers

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Simon Reeve meets a farmer who has enlisted the help of beavers to help with the problem of flooding, and Marcus Wareing shows how to cook apple tarte tatin

programme.title: Back in Time for...
programme.desc: The Arderns reflect on the lessons learned through the series, and how corner shops can continue to thrive in the changing world of 21st-century business. The programme examines how shops have reinvented themselves to compete with mini-supermarkets, the rise of zero-waste shops, and how other businesses, like cafes, coffee shops and micro pubs, are filling the role of community hub

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Broadcaster Mariella Frostrup and her friend, the fashion and interior designer Pearl Lowe, go searching for antiques in their adopted county of Somerset. Both are paired with personal shoppers offering sage guidance - dealer Raj Bisram and auctioneer James Braxton. The items that catch their eyes include Norwegian jewellery, African sculpture and some traditional English furniture. But who will haggle the hardest when it comes to making a deal?

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Milestones Museum in Basingstoke, alongside experts James Lewis and Elizabeth Talbot. Featuring a Hampshire sculptor who carves giant spiders

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nina Conti, Nick Helm, Athena Kugblenu and Toby Tarrant go toe to toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to Northern Ireland's spectacular Causeway coast to begin a new journey, which takes him along the north and east coasts through Ulster and Leinster. He begins in Co Derry on the windswept shores of Loch Foyle, where the largest accumulation of coastal sands in Ireland has formed a system of dunes visible from space. He also learns how scientists are monitoring the site and hears how their work has been picked up by fellow scientists in the United States to help research the surface of Mars

programme.title: Digging for Britain: The Greatest Discoveries
programme.desc: Professor Alice Roberts re-examines the key archaeological sites of Roman Britain, from the foundation of Londinium in the south to fierce siege battles in the north

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson visits the Yorkshire coastal village of Flamborough and discovers its historic chalk buildings. Local historian and archaeologist Andrew Jones shows Ben around Flamborough Tower. Constructed in 1674 and standing 87 feet tall, the tower was built with the purpose of improving ship to shore navigation but would ultimately be used by local law enforcers in a bid to prevent smuggling

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan present the annual series charting the fortunes of British wildlife during the changing of the seasons, live from RSPB Arne in Dorset

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: The devastating impact of the conflict is explored through the stories of three women, as IRA prisoners begin their hunger strike in protest against Margaret Thatcher's policies. Tit for tat killings, car bombs and assassinations became commonplace in Northern Ireland and fatigue from a population desperate for a respite from the cycle of violence creeps in

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig returns with a 'well sick' edition, joined by regular panellist Alan Davies, along with Maisie Adam, Jo Brand and Lee Mack

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: The Eiger Sanction (1975)
programme.desc: An art professor who once worked as an assassin is blackmailed into returning to his old career to eliminate a spy. However, his target is in the middle of a mountaineering expedition, forcing the hitman to embark on a perilous climb up the Eiger in hot pursuit. Action adventure, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With George Kennedy, Jack Cassidy and Vonetta McGee

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Preston and Kai give the school something to talk about and the school poetry slam gets off to a rocky start. Amy comes face to face with her crush after an awkward encounter and a technical faux pas exposes everything

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith and Matt Baker travel to Upper Teesdale in the Durham Dales, where Charlotte meets 97-year-old botanist Dr Margaret Bradshaw, who for the past 70 years has been at the forefront of classifying, surveying and protecting the rare flora of Widdybank Fell. Matt joins members of the Durham Wildlife Trust as they survey endangered ground nesting wading birds by using sound monitoring posts that can distinguish calls from individual species and calculate how many birds are in the area

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The sewers are tasked with making garments for a travel wardrobe, starting with a good sturdy rucksack. For the transformation they head to the seaside to sculpt windbreakers into emergency rainwear before creating some made-to-measure swimsuits

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust
programme.desc: The documentary goes behind the scenes of two historic homes in the south of England. The National Trust work to preserve the gardens of Sissinghurst Castle in Kent in the same style that previous owner Vita Sackville-West planted them back in the 1930s. Twelve miles away, the Jacobean manor Bateman's was the sanctuary of Rudyard Kipling until his death in 1936. The plan is to preserve his personal possessions to tell not just the story of Kipling the author, but also the man and father

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Documentary capturing the beauty of butterflies close up, and revealing how they inspire the images of street artist Nick Walker and the performances of burlesque dancer Vicky Butterfly. The programme also raises the question of whether a passion for these elegant insects could help people preserve much-loved landscapes. Narrated by Imelda Staunton

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Countryfile presenters Adam Henson and Steve Brown team up with antique experts David Harper and Roo Irvine for a trip around the rolling Cotswold Hills, hoping to find items that will make the biggest profit at auction. The competing duo also explore the area's history, with Adam discovering the vital work a charity played saving horses during the Great War and Steve taking a trip down a canal to learn how a little boat saved hundreds of lives at Dunkirk

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: At the RAF Museum at Hendon in London, antiques experts Anita Manning and Mark Stacey find some real treasures among the bags and boxes to take to auction. There's a photo album of the facility in the '30s and a rare picture that brings a surprise in the saleroom. Plus, presenter Paul Martin visits an exhibition of First World War flying pioneers

programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in the glens of Antrim, where he is transfixed by tales of fairies and legends of the sea. At the entrance to Belfast Lough in Whitehead he discovers a museum which tells the story of Ireland's railway heritage. He also sees if he has what it takes to join the local rowing club. At the medieval Carrickfergus Castle, Michael learns of the town's important role in the history of Ireland, when William of Orange landed at its harbour and went on to fight the Battle of the Boyne, which is commemorated by Unionists to this day

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits a secret location in the Cotswolds, which appears to be a high-status Anglo Saxon cemetery, where she finds a very precious and fragile artefact

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan appreciate spring's simple wildlife pleasures at RSPB Arne in Dorset and reveal footage documenting the lifecycle of a jellyfish

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: A 12-year-old girl comes forward to say she has been groomed online and raped several times, so West Midlands Police quickly identify and arrest the suspect. However, as it is several weeks since the alleged attacks, there is limited physical evidence, so the officers have to rely on digital forensics, leaning heavily on two smartphones seized from the suspect

Tobey Maguire and Liev Schreiber star in this fact-based sporting drama set in 1972 during the Cold War

programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Bakeation
programme.desc: The duo bike through the Netherlands, Belgium and Luxembourg, where dishes include Dutch apple pie, Jewish buns, chocolate truffle cheesecake and macaroons with ice-cream

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: A man shares his passion for allotment gardening, Paul Rose gets on his bike with a group of cyclists, and Chris Packham and Megan McCubbin visit a colony of puffins

programme.title: Lost Land of the Jaguar
programme.desc: Scientists, climbers and wildlife film-makers explore the rainforests of Guyana, a former British colony in South America. Cameraman Gordon Buchanan finds giant otters almost as large as he is, canopy expert Justine Evans observes a family of red howler monkeys, and biologist Steve Backshall probes a habitat below a massive waterfall where frogs and freshwater crabs happily co-exist

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: I'm a Celebrity comrades Stanley Johnson and Georgia 'Toff' Toffolo compete to find profit-making antiques in Cumbria, guided by auctioneers Paul Laidlaw and Izzie Balmer. Toff takes time out from shopping to learn about the importance boats have played in the Lake District and Stanley learns about the conversation work of artist John Ruskin

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Laidlaw and David Harper hunt for antiques in the Bowes Museum at Barnard Castle in Co Durham. The venue was purpose-built to house the collection of Josephine and John Bowes. Presented by Paul Martin

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nina Conti, Nick Helm, Athena Kugblenu and Toby Tarrant test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo is in Bangor, County Down, en route to the Northern Irish capital of Belfast. Along the way he enjoys live music on a boat, stops off at the imposing parliament building at Stormont and explores the regenerated Titanic Quarter on the Maritime Mile

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: In Northern Ireland, the graveyard of a Victorian workhouse sheds light on one of the most traumatic periods of modern Irish history, the Great Famine of 1845. A team from Sheffield University want to understand the lives of people who occupied a village near the famous caves at Cresswell Crags in Nottinghamshire, and near Lincoln, a revisit to an Anglo Saxon site near proves rewarding

programme.title: Springwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan have their eyes set on the developing nests at RSPB Arne in Dorset, and Gillian Burke is moving down to the Llyn Peninsular in north Wales

programme.title: The Gallows Pole
programme.desc: David gathers his family and friends and explains he has brought some tools from Birmingham giving them the potential to transform everyone's lives. He then gives them a demonstration in the art of coin clipping, a method of forgery which uses slivers taken from one several real coins to make a counterfeit version. All they need now is to round up enough money to get them started. Shane Meadows drama, starring Michael Socha, Thomas Turgoose and Sophie McShera

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.desc: The inimitable Larry Dean introduces comedians Harriet Kemsley and Slim to the stage

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
programme.desc: The BBC's world affairs editor reflects on the week's major global news stories, talking to local experts from around the world to go behind the headlines

programme.title: The Edge (2019)
programme.desc: Documentary about England's Test cricket team between 2009 and 2013, the first and only English side to ever reach the top of the world rankings. Featuring contributions from Andrew Strauss, Kevin Pietersen, Alastair Cook, James Anderson, Stuart Broad, Monty Panesar, Graeme Swann, Jonathan Trott, Matt Prior, Ian Bell, Paul Collingwood, Steven Finn, Tim Bresnan, David Saker and Andy Flower

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: William Grint joins a group of deaf activists on an Extinction Rebellion demonstration in London. Julian Peedle-Calloo and Yvonne Cobb meet Kabir Kapoor, who has just become the first BSL Poet Laureate. And three deaf artists talk about their love of working with their hands

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Julia, Gloria and Angela hear from online shoppers who received the wrong order but were refused a refund and look at the importance of reading terms and conditions

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The five hopefuls are tasked to create a dish with ingredients that on paper shouldn't work, but that becomes an unlikely tasty treat. They then head off to the Francis Crick Institute in central London, Europe's largest biomedical laboratory, which aims to gain further understand into how living things work, and carries out ground-breaking research with the aim of helping to treat, diagnose and prevent human disease, where under the acclaimed chef Jozef Youssef, they cook a five-course celebratory lunch, recreating one of Josef's technically demanding recipes

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc: Paul Rose sets off to walk all 630 miles of the South West Coast Path. The explorer hopes to discover wildlife, wild traditions and wild adventure at every turn

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack considers building designs of the 19th century. He visits Eastnor Castle in Herefordshire to examine the work of architect Robert Smirke, then travels to St Giles's Church in Cheadle, Staffordshire, to study the Gothic-inspired designs of Augustus Pugin

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc: Using 3D scanning technology, Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott uncover the hidden history of three Italian cities, beginning with Naples, from its earliest Greek and Roman origins. The pair explore the impact of the volcano of Mount Vesuvius, and how it both nurtured the region and exacted a terrible price on the local population. Alexander and Michael also delve into a labyrinth of underground spaces constructed by ruling Bourbon kings in the 19th century, that helped to sustain the city

programme.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
programme.desc: Bendor Grosvenor and Emma Dabiri investigate a painting by 18th-century artist Joseph Wright of Derby, housed at the Derby Museum. The piece suffered an industrial scale restoration in the 1970s, but can the team peel back layers of modern restoration on the mysterious landscape painting stuck in the Derby vaults to reveal another hidden masterpiece?

programme.title: Britain's Biggest Warship
programme.desc: HMS Queen Elizabeth goes on dangerous sea trials for the first time in the North Sea, where every part of the vessel is put to the test and the first aircraft lands on the deck. After a few days at sea, the first problems start to emerge, including an explosion, a dangerous fuel leak, and some strange noises. Meanwhile, a crew member reveals how the Navy helped him make a fresh start from a life of crime, and the ship's Muslim chef works out how to cook pork without offending his religion

programme.title: Timewatch
programme.desc: Looters made the most of an opportunity when the MSC Napoli ran aground in January 2007, spilling its cargo on Branscombe beach in Devon. However, they were reviving a tradition that stretches back centuries - connecting coastal communities around Britain to a sinister profession. Author Bella Bathurst embarks on an epic journey from the Isles of Scilly to the Orkney Islands to explore wrecking

programme.title: Men at the Barre: Inside the Royal Ballet
programme.desc: Award-winning filmmaker Richard Macer is invited to film with a golden generation of talented young male dancers at the Royal Ballet to find out what it takes to be an elite dancer. Throughout the film, Richard learns that in the past, the man's role was just to lift the ballerina into the air, but now, the top male dancers have fanbases that even rival the best ballerina's. He also explores changes in choreography, which is starting to reflect masculinity in different ways, mirroring the changing perception of what it is to be man outside in the wider world

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc: Paul Rose sets off to walk all 630 miles of the South West Coast Path. The explorer hopes to discover wildlife, wild traditions and wild adventure at every turn

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Building of Britain
programme.desc: The former steeplejack considers building designs of the 19th century. He visits Eastnor Castle in Herefordshire to examine the work of architect Robert Smirke, then travels to St Giles's Church in Cheadle, Staffordshire, to study the Gothic-inspired designs of Augustus Pugin

The piece suffered an industrial scale restoration in the 1970s, but can the team peel back layers of modern restoration on the mysterious landscape painting stuck in the Derby vaults to reveal another hidden masterpiece?

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc: Traversing the rugged and mysterious north Cornish coast, explorer Paul Rose's first stop is Morwenstow, where he squeezes into the Trust's smallest property, the Hawker's Hut. Built in the 1800s by opium-smoking poet Reverend Hawker, it is popular with walkers who add their own graffiti. Next, Paul enjoys a tour of the wild and majestic Tintagel Castle, before heading to Padstow where the Mayday 'Obby 'Oss celebrations are in full swing. Paul is then put through his paces by a group of youngsters training to be surf lifesavers at Newquay's Fistral Beach

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc: The former steeplejack sets out on an enthusiastic tour of Britain's industrial heritage, exploring the early use of wind and water power and visiting some steam engines still in use today. On his travels Fred meets a man who has built a windmill in his back garden and hunts for examples of early beam engines that are still functioning today

programme.title: The Best of Les Dawson
programme.desc: Tribute to the comedian featuring clips of some of his best sketches and stand-up routines. First shown in May 1997

programme.title: Talking Comedy
programme.desc: Angela Thorne narrates a look back at clips of the comedian and writer's appearances on some of the BBC's best-loved talk shows

programme.title: The Many Faces of
programme.desc: Profile of the Manchester-born comedian known for his deadpan humour and jokes at the expense of his wife and mother-in-law. The programme explores his beginnings in northern clubs and appearance on talent show Opportunity Knocks, and charts his rise to stardom. Contributors include John Cleese, Robert Webb and Russell Kane. Narrated by Sally Phillips

programme.title: Brian Cox's Jute Journey
programme.desc: The Succession actor travels to Calcutta, retracing the journey of jute workers who started out in his home city of Dundee and went on to seek their fortunes in India. On the way he meets Lily Thompson, who went deaf while working in the mills, and spent years using a special sign-language to communicate with the other workers. He also meets members of the Calcutta and Moffusil Society and samples deep-fried jute

programme.title: Neutrino: Hunting the Ghost Particle
programme.desc: The astonishing tale of how scientists have battled against the odds to detect and decode the neutrino - the strangest, most elusive particle in the universe

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: Holliday Grainger and Callum Turner star in a six-part crime thriller. Soldier Shaun Emery has his conviction for murder overturned because of flawed evidence, and returns home to Britain a free man. However, when damning CCTV footage of him comes to light, he ends up the subject of another investigation. Newly promoted detective Rachel Carey is assigned to the case, and quickly learns the truth is not as simple as it appears

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: The crucial CCTV footage of Shaun's supposed crime is seized by a mysterious MI5 officer, leaving Rachel convinced the truth behind the case is not as clear cut as it first appeared. However, getting answers may prove difficult when the surveillance system is found wanting. After a confrontation with his ex-partner, Shaun is determined to prove his innocence, and recruits an old friend to help him break into Hannah's flat and find evidence. Ron Perlman (Hellboy) joins the cast of the conspiracy thriller

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: Shaun is interrogated by the CIA in a covert safe house, and while Rachel sees CCTV footage of him going in, she then finds she is unable to locate him inside. Her investigation leads her to make shocking discoveries about the degree to which CCTV footage might be manipulated. Finally released by his American captors, Shaun goes on the run from the police - but his quest to clear his name soon takes a devastating turn

programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc: Traversing the rugged and mysterious north Cornish coast, explorer Paul Rose's first stop is Morwenstow, where he squeezes into the Trust's smallest property, the Hawker's Hut. programme.title: Coastal Path
programme.desc: Paul Rose explores the spectacular coastline of southern Cornwall, discovering one of the world's finest stages at the Minack open-air theatre in Porthcurno. He also tries out the high-octane sport of coasteering on the Lizard Peninsula, joins a National Trust ranger for some clifftop wildlife spotting, and fires the Tudor cannons of Pendennis Castle in Falmouth

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Industrial Age
programme.desc: An exploration of the textile mills and factories that once thrived in Britain during the Industrial Revolution. From New Lanark in Scotland to the mill town of Burnley, Fred meets ex-workers to discover what life was really like, and chats to a group that has dedicated 30 years to restoring mill engines

programme.title: Secret Knowledge
programme.desc: The presenter tells the story of the 17th-century residence in Derbyshire - the pleasure palace of playboy Cavalier and ambitious courtier William Cavendish. Through a collection of artworks and items held within the castle, Lucy uncovers a colourful tale, capturing the tensions of England in the 1600s that would eventually lead the nation to civil war

programme.title: Lucy Worsley's Fireworks for a Tudor Queen
programme.desc: The historian teams up with materials scientist Zoe Laughlin in an ambitious attempt to recreate one of the earliest and most spectacular firework displays in Britain. The extravagant festivities were originally laid on by Robert Dudley, a close friend of Queen Elizabeth I, as an attempt win the Virgin Queen's hand in marriage in 1575, and Lucy travels to Italy for clues on how to make the Tudor equivalent of a Catherine Wheel

programme.title: Kisses at Fifty
programme.desc: Bill Maynard stars in Colin Welland's 1973 play about a married factory worker who kisses a barmaid in front of the whole pub on his 50th birthday - and the consequences for all around him. Directed by Michael Apted and co-starring Rosemarie Dunham, Marjorie Yates and Lori Wells

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: Rachel finally comes face to face with Shaun, who offers up the location of the CIA safe house before managing to evade arrest once more. The fugitive soldier flees into an encounter with two mysterious strangers, who offer to provide him with the answers he is looking for. Rachel pays Napier a visit, and the meeting leaves her more convinced than ever that the CCTV network has been compromised

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: The truth behind what happened to Shaun is revealed to him as he finally comes face to face with the powers behind his downfall. Rachel seeks answers of her own after her suspicions that Shaun has been set up are confirmed by a vital piece of evidence. However, the truth they both uncover places their lives in great danger

programme.title: The Capture
programme.desc: The mysterious Jessica Mallory arrives in London as the most closely guarded secrets of the intelligence services face exposure. Bad Idea Puppy and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny show him his new living room and explain that they decorated with the best bright things they could think of. As Elder Kitten looks on a little unsure, Love Monster asks him whether he loves it. Elder Kitten is a little lost for words and, not wanting to hurt their feelings, he simply agrees with them that it's bright and very different. Love Monster can tell that Elder Kitten doesn't like it, and eventually Elder Kitten gently admits that it's not really his style

At a press conference discussing the exhumation, questions are raised about the line of enquiry regarding Willoughby, and why more is not being done to eliminate other suspects first. Paul nonetheless puts all his efforts into following the Kappen theory, forcing Phil and Geraint to take matters into their own hands

Despite trying to stay out of trouble, nurse Mikey faces all the ward banter as suspect number one when a vital medicine machine malfunctions. Meanwhile, Caitlin faces her first shift in Resus as a qualified nurse. She holds her own well, but has a patient whose case illustrates just how fast things can take a turn in A&E

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. Now, there's growing evidence suggesting this could be linked to the food we eat. Ultra-processed convenience foods contain chemicals that UK regulators say are safe, but Panorama investigates emerging scientific evidence of a link between some of these chemicals and cancer, diabetes, and strokes

programme.desc: Jacqui Joseph visits Earlswood Recycling centre where she finds some sofa leather for luggage expert Neil Wragg to put to use and a mannequin for her to upcycle and sell on

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Two newlyweds enlist the help of Ginny Buckley in their search for a new home in the Dorset countryside. Having grown out of their town flat they need enough space for all their hobbies

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Lee and Chris head to Derby to help Bal and her family restore her late mum's garden to its former glory. With a budget of 6,500 the pair aim to make a colourful, Indian-inspired space where the family can gather and watch Bollywood movies on their outdoor cinema screen

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Lauren Laverne present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Elaine has a decision to make about George as Linda begs her to end their relationship. Having sold the Arches to Sharon, Ben focuses all his attention on Lexi but she is finding it hard to open up. Keanu is stunned to discover Sharon bought the Arches for him and he admits he is finding it difficult knowing that she is the one supporting him

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Shola's behaviour causes concern with the staff leading Val to investigate. Kelly Jo's first day out of the BU goes from bad to worse when a kind-hearted gesture from Dean backfires. Myles causes problems for Joe who is already reeling from an unexpected visitor, leaving him and Mike feeling uncertain about the future

programme.title: Steeltown Murders: Hunting a Serial Killer
programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. With revealing interviews from detectives at the heart of the re-investigation and emotional first-time interviews from friends and family of the girls, the programme reveals how, after nearly 30 years, Wales's first serial killer was finally unmasked

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: When Thorfinn's bones are discovered on the property, he asks Sam to conduct the traditional Viking funeral he's always wanted, but Sam and Jay are torn when they learn that the bones could be sold to a museum for a lot of much-needed cash

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Sam and Jay invite Henry and Margaret to a dinner party to woo them into allowing the bed and breakfast, and the ghosts are desperately eager to be included on the guest list

programme.title: Rookie Nurses
programme.desc: Leah has spent almost two months nursing a patient from the same farming community as her recover after surgery. It's a sad but proud moment when he's finally well enough to leave. Despite trying to stay out of trouble, nurse Mikey faces all the ward banter as suspect number one when a vital medicine machine malfunctions. Meanwhile, Caitlin faces her first shift in Resus as a qualified nurse. She holds her own well, but has a patient whose case illustrates just how fast things can take a turn in A&E

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Zara tries to lay low while Scarlett and Ollie up their game. Rob goes on a mission to contact Nancy who hasn't been seen in months

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: In Somerset, Sarah Moore explores Keynsham Recycling Centre, searching for three items she hopes can be revived. There's a cast iron mangle for woodworker Bruce Faulseit and upholsterer Leigh-Anne Treadwell sets to work trying to give a much-cherished chair a second chance. Sarah herself has a metal bed frame to repurpose

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson is in the Welsh county of Powys with a couple whose wish list includes an annexe for their parents, along with at least half an acre of land for their budget of 650,000. Jules also meets a man who scours space with his telescopes, looking for large, undiscovered objects that could be on a collision course with Earth

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie and Flo go head-to-head to design a garden to match Jo and Jack's Victorian terraced house. They have just 4,500 to tick all the boxes on the couple's extensive wishlist

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team head to Homerton, east London to help entrepreneurs Rob and Haley make the most out of their two-bed house that is overrun with pets

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan joins Alexander Armstrong to co-host the quiz, in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the most obscure answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones presents the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Suki sets her plan to take down Nish into action and Linda is determined to find some dirt on George. Sharon worries about Keanu's business skills so she hires Reiss to take care of the Arches accounts. Ben and Jay finally get Lexi to open up

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team welcome the Poet Laureate Simon Armitage into the Repair Shop who brings with him a harmonium, the subject of one of his poems that brings back memories of his late father. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. Finally, Kirsty visits jeweller Richard Talman, hoping he can fix her mum's silver charm bracelet gifted to her mother by her father in the early 1960s

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: BBC Wales Live
programme.desc: Bethan Rhys Roberts presents the weekly show featuring stories and in-depth interviews about what is happening in Wales and why it matters

programme.title: How Did Our Sons Become Killers?
programme.desc: The mothers of boys who killed people share their feelings, and reflect on how their personal experiences might help others to prevent further deaths in the future. One woman describes the moment she realised her son had attacked a stranger, while another says she's now forgiven her mentally ill son for stabbing her and killing his father

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: The third kiss-off ends with a bang, as Dannii Minogue asks the couples to make their toughest choice yet - whether their relationships can survive outside the show. For one pairing, this represents a particular challenge, as they live a great distance from each other

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: The boys decide if they want to take their relationship into the real world - but not before one final party where everyone dresses up as their favourite queer icon. On the final day, family and friends come to visit, which leaves some of the boys with the unique experience of introducing them to a partner for the first time

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Linda struggles with the Knight family invasion on the Vic and George speaks to Phil about a collaboration with the Boxing Den. Ben reveals his plan to sell the Arches but Phil is not impressed when he finds out the potential buyer is Sharon. Things are tense with the Panesars and Eve and Suki find their chance to get rid of Nish for good

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: The UK is facing a chronic illness epidemic, with diabetes rates at record levels and cancers in young people rising steeply. Now, there's growing evidence suggesting this could be linked to the food we eat. Ultra-processed convenience foods contain chemicals that UK regulators say are safe, but Panorama investigates emerging scientific evidence of a link between some of these chemicals and cancer, diabetes, and strokes

programme.title: Scotland's Home of the Year
programme.desc: Judges Anna Campbell Jones, Michael Angus and Banjo Beale head south, paying a visit to two properties in Dumfries & Galloway - a new build eco house and a former milking barn with contemporary extension. They also assess an historic renovation on the outskirts of Peebles, thought to date back to the 16th century

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc: Paul insists on having Kappen's body exhumed. Jackie reluctantly allows it, but warns him that a wrong step could fatally compromise the force's reputation. At a press conference discussing the exhumation, questions are raised about the line of enquiry regarding Willoughby, and why more is not being done to eliminate other suspects first. Paul nonetheless puts all his efforts into following the Kappen theory, forcing Phil and Geraint to take matters into their own hands

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Naga Munchetty hosts an extended episode of the satirical quiz with Hugh Dennis and Ruth Davidson joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The MUAs' skills are tested to the limits when they work in teams to produce digital looks for Adidas at Metaverse Fashion Week, where they must impress guest judge Isamaya Ffrench. Back in the studio they're tasked with producing cartoon characters that live in a made-up world, with one of the contestants eliminated at the end of the challenge

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The MUAs' skills are tested to the limits when they work in teams to produce digital looks for Adidas at Metaverse Fashion Week, where they must impress guest judge Isamaya Ffrench. Back in the studio they're tasked with producing cartoon characters that live in a made-up world, with one of the contestants eliminated at the end of the challenge

programme.desc: Lee and Chris head to Derby to help Bal and her family restore her late mum's garden to its former glory. With a budget of 6,500 the pair aim to make a colourful, Indian-inspired space where the family can gather and watch Bollywood movies on their outdoor cinema screen

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: The team help an avid recycler whose small flat is bursting at the seams. With a limited budget and 24 hours, they transform the overflowing spare room into a dining area

programme.title: Pointless

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Lauren Laverne present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Elaine has a decision to make about George as Linda begs her to end their relationship. Having sold the Arches to Sharon, Ben focuses all his attention on Lexi but she is finding it hard to open up. Keanu is stunned to discover Sharon bought the Arches for him and he admits he is finding it difficult knowing that she is the one supporting him

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Shola's behaviour causes concern with the staff leading Val to investigate. Kelly Jo's first day out of the BU goes from bad to worse when a kind-hearted gesture from Dean backfires. Myles causes problems for Joe who is already reeling from an unexpected visitor, leaving him and Mike feeling uncertain about the future

programme.title: Steeltown Murders: Hunting a Serial Killer
programme.desc: This companion documentary to the BBC drama Steeltown Murders tells the inside story of the police investigation into the 1973 murders of three teenage girls near the steel town of Port Talbot. With revealing interviews from detectives at the heart of the re-investigation and emotional first-time interviews from friends and family of the girls, the programme reveals how, after nearly 30 years, Wales's first serial killer was finally unmasked

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: Stephen Dempster investigates why cases are taking so long to get to trial. Murder and rape cases can take over five years to conclude leaving victims in traumatic nightmare situations. Stephen speaks to some of these victims and hears from experts who fear the system is at breaking point

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: When Thorfinn's bones are discovered on the property, he asks Sam to conduct the traditional Viking funeral he's always wanted, but Sam and Jay are torn when they learn that the bones could be sold to a museum for a lot of much-needed cash

programme.title: Ghosts US
programme.desc: Sam and Jay invite Henry and Margaret to a dinner party to woo them into allowing the bed and breakfast, and the ghosts are desperately eager to be included on the guest list

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Composer Andrew Lloyd Webber knows he comes from a musical family, including virtuoso cellist brother Julian, but he is curious as to where his showbusiness genes and love of musical theatre come from. By following his mother's line, Andrew soon uncovers a certain Uncle Peregrine, who played a key role under Wellington at the Battle of Waterloo. On his father's side, Henry Simmonds was a missionary who dedicated his life to helping the poor and needy. Andrew is astonished to uncover stories that uncannily parallel his own life, including an ancestor with a famous cello-playing brother

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team welcome the Poet Laureate Simon Armitage into the Repair Shop who brings with him a harmonium, the subject of one of his poems that brings back memories of his late father. Cobbler Dean Westmoreland is given the task of repairing Valerie's pair of children's leather clogs that were bought to help her sister with mobility issues balance in the 1950s. Kirsten Ramsay is tasked with reviving Martin's broken sculpture depicting his mother as a young woman made by a Czechoslovakian art student in 1947. Finally, Kirsty visits jeweller Richard Talman, hoping he can fix her mum's silver charm bracelet gifted to her mother by her father in the early 1960s

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: The 10 remaining sewers make and celebrate garments from West Africa. Sara Pascoe and judges Patrick Grant and Esme Young are joined by guest judge, Nigerian fashion designer, Banke Kuku. The pattern challenge takes inspiration from a Ghanaian Batakari or Fugu tunic which involves sewing strips of handwoven deboya fabric. In the transformation challenge, the sewers have 90 minutes to make hand-dyed adire fabric into dresses by draping the fabric on the stand. In the made to measure challenge, the contestants make dramatic, flowing wide-sleeved robes worn by people across West Africa

programme.title: Vicky McClure: My Grandad's War
programme.desc: In this one-off special to mark the anniversary of D-Day, the actress embarks on an emotional journey with her 97-year-old grandfather, Ralph, to learn about his role in the most extraordinary single day of the Second World War. Vicky sets out to understand how Ralph - then still a teenager from Nottingham - found himself in the Royal Navy and at the centre of a world-changing battle on the Normandy beaches on June 6, 1944. The pair visit the only surviving example of the type of landing craft he trained and crossed the Channel on, and discover aerial pictures believed to show his flotilla landing at Normandy - before travelling back to the beach he last visited almost 80 years ago

programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. programme.title: Martin Clunes: Islands of America
programme.desc: The actor travels around the coast of the United States to discover what life is like on the surrounding islands. He sets off on a 10,000-mile journey from the west to the east, to explore the vast swathe of islands that are scattered beyond America's shores. The first port of call on his journey is Hawaii, and his exploration looks beyond its image as a tourist paradise, crammed with sun-kissed beaches and world-class surfing, and into the havoc wreaked by advancing lava fields and smoking craters. Leaving Hawaii, Martin flies 2,500 miles north to the islands of Alaska, where the contrast couldn't be more extreme, from tropical rain forests to snow-fringed glaciers, and from crowded beaches to some of America's most sparsely populated territories

programme.title: Vicky McClure: My Grandad's War
programme.desc: In this one-off special to mark the anniversary of D-Day, the actress embarks on an emotional journey with her 97-year-old grandfather, Ralph, to learn about his role in the most extraordinary single day of the Second World War. Vicky sets out to understand how Ralph - then still a teenager from Nottingham - found himself in the Royal Navy and at the centre of a world-changing battle on the Normandy beaches on June 6, 1944. The pair visit the only surviving example of the type of landing craft he trained and crossed the Channel on, and discover aerial pictures believed to show his flotilla landing at Normandy - before travelling back to the beach he last visited almost 80 years ago

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec return to host the grand finale of the talent search, while Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and Bruno Tonioli form the judging panel. Taking to stage are the acts who secured the judges' and public votes across the semi-finals, but the public vote alone determines the outcome of the final, where the chosen favourite will be named the winner of Britain's Got Talent 2023. As always, the victor will also be leaving the competition with the life-changing 250,000 cash prize and a coveted place at the Royal Variety Performance

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: Ring agent Sydney mistakes Devon for a world-class spy and kidnaps him, leaving Casey and Sarah to calm Chuck down when he discovers his brother-in-law is missing

programme.desc: Dating show in which a celebrity has three meals cooked for them by three unsuspecting blind dates. In this episode, reality TV star Amber Davies chooses three men to date based on the menus she most likes the look of, before choosing to see one of them again

programme.title: Celebrity Catchphrase
programme.desc: A special edition of the game show in which host Stephen Mulhern invites pairs Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford, Brian McFadden and Vogue Williams, and Vic Reeves and Bob Mortimer to 'say what they see'. The famous duos must correctly identify popular phrases based only on illustrative cartoons, in the hope of scoring enough points to win a cash prize for their charity of choice

programme.desc: The comedian takes a trip down memory lane as he presents a series of classic TV game shows, which have all been updated with a new final round offering the contestants a chance to win big. The next four weeks will see Alan in charge of The Price Is Right, Take Your Pick, Strike it Lucky and Bullseye. But tonight he steps into the shoes of much-missed funnyman Bruce Forsyth for Play Your Cards Right, which sees four celebrity couples taking a chance on the turn of a single card. programme.desc: Jackie prosecutes her mother's friend for negligence in the workplace, and Blaketon expresses his disapproval of Bellamy's relationship with Gina in no uncertain terms. programme.desc: As the sleuth studies for his forthcoming sergeant's exam, he investigates a hit-and-run that claimed the life of an eminent Oxford professor. The victim had been at odds with his peers over the fate of a potentially lucrative parcel of college-owned land, and the case is complicated by the appearance of DI Thursday's old gangland enemy - whom he must face alone while Endeavour makes a trip back to Lincolnshire to visit his ailing father

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: A gangland killing takes a surprising twist when it turns out the victim has been sexually mutilated. Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp, Sean Maguire and Nicholas Gleaves star

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
