programme.desc: Part one of two. Dispirited by a wet English summer, the Larkins cross the Channel in the hope that the French way of life will have a beneficial effect on the family. David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones star

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.desc: Part two of two. The family warms to the French way of life, but Charley is unhappy with Mariette's flirting - and after a little Dutch courage, decides to take matters into his own hands. Drama, starring Philip Franks and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Vernon suffers delusions of grandeur while playing bodyguard to a Russian prince staying at Ashfordly Hall, leaving David to help Bellamy with preparations for a special VIP evening of his own. Elsewhere in Aidensfield, Mike's niece pays a visit, and proves to be a typical teenager by getting up to all sorts of mischief. Rural drama, starring Mark Jordon and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sergeant Craddock investigates a suspicious road accident, and has to suffer the embarrassment of interrogating the High Sheriff about his involvement in the incident. Meanwhile, Gina has shattering news for Phil Bellamy, and Vernon opens a marriage bureau, which proves to have unforeseen consequences - for David at least. Rural drama, guest starring Angela Douglas (Carry On Cowboy)

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Diane throws a surprise medieval birthday party for Jack, giving Katie and Robert the perfect excuse to be alone together. Later, Nicola apologises to Simon

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Andy asks Robert to be his best man, oblivious to his true intentions. Simon and Nicola get on like a house on fire while delivering flyers and Eddie packs his bags

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: The horror of the murder reverberates as the residents try to come to terms with the grisly event, while an innocent man is put behind bars for a crime he did not commit

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ade is charged with murder and asks Ken to chaperone him during questioning, while shifty Richard shows signs of cracking after coming face to face with Maxine's friends and family

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: When an unpopular employee at a military psychiatric hospital is found murdered, there is no shortage of suspects, but a colleague of the man, an exiled Polish Jew, holds himself responsible for the death. Foyle is convinced there is another explanation, but his priorities shift when news of a missing boy from London reaches Hastings. Starring Michael Kitchen, Phyllida Law and Nicholas Woodeson

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy finds himself in over his head when he allows personal feelings to cloud his judgement in the case of a robbery suspect. Meanwhile, Vernon hopes great things will come of his newly installed party phone line. Rural drama, starring Mark Jordon and Geoffrey Hughes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An investigation into the appearance of forged bank notes in Aidensfield leads to the discovery of a major crime operation, and Blaketon is persuaded to try a new image by Vernon _ with unfortunate repercussions. Meanwhile, Mike's suggestion that he and Jackie start a family is not met with the expected response. Rural police drama, starring Geoffrey Hughes and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A case from 13 years earlier returns to haunt Lewis when the evidence comes under review. Graham Lawrie was incarcerated in a secure psychiatric hospital after being found guilty of the murders of three police officers, but now the findings of the forensics lab have been called into question and an appeal has been launched. As Lawrie remains locked up ahead of his day in court, PC Mark Travis is lured to an isolated location with a hoax call and falls victim to a killer who uses the same weapon as that used in the original murders

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: The detectives investigate the murder of a wealthy man whose double life left him vulnerable to exploitation. Away from work, Rachel's recent moment of indiscretion threatens to come back to haunt her when a confused Sean takes a phone call from her one-night stand, and after Ade is pushed into living with his girlfriend on a permanent basis, Janet asks her mother to move in

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Troubled saleswoman Helen (Nicola Walker), whose mother was murdered back in episode one, turns up on Janet's doorstep with information that takes the investigation in a completely different direction - paving the way for the formidable Det Supt Julie Dodson to be called in. Meanwhile, new recruit Sgt Rob Waddington arrives on the scene - putting Janet's nose out of joint as she is demoted back down to constable. Emmerdale star Danny Miller (Aaron Livesy) joins the cast

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.desc: Part one of two. Dispirited by a wet English summer, the Larkins cross the Channel in the hope that the French way of life will have a beneficial effect on the family. David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones star

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.desc: Part two of two. The family warms to the French way of life, but Charley is unhappy with Mariette's flirting - and after a little Dutch courage, decides to take matters into his own hands. Drama, starring Philip Franks and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur is held by the police after a car he is importing from Europe is impounded by drugs officers, so Terry goes in search of those he suspects are responsible for his boss' predicament - the vehicle's original owners. Light-hearted crime drama, starring George Cole and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Doyle is shot by an intruder in his flat, and enters a near coma. Cowley fears a terrorist group - two of whose members were blown up during a recent car chase by CI5 - is responsible. While Doyle experiences surreal dreams involving a ghostly graveyard, Cowley and Bodie attempt to pursue the villain behind the attack. Action drama, with Martin Shaw, Lewis Collins and Gordon Jackson

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Templar is called in to help a Russian physicist who wants to defect to America. Vintage adventure, starring Roger Moore, with Guy Deghy, Anthony Booth and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: An elderly widow enlists Holmes' help to ascertain why a mystery purchaser should want to buy not just her house, but also all its contents. Drama, starring Jeremy Brett, Edward Hardwicke and Peter Wyngarde

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: Part two of two. The detectives fear for their lives when an old army friend reveals that a Russian agent who tortured them in Vietnam is determined to finish the job

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: Simon Templar encounters a deadly lady with a gun and an attitude - and soon finds himself caught in the middle of an all-out revolution. Starring Roger Moore

programme.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A man dies suddenly of a mysterious fever and Holmes suspects murder, but a malign influence takes its toll on the detective as he delves into the underworld of London's docklands. Starring Jeremy Brett, with Roy Hudd

programme.title: Isle of Man TT
programme.desc: Action from the opening sidecar race, as the riders took on the mountain course in the three-wheeled vehicles, with Ben and Tom Birchall looking to continue their unbeaten run

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: A team of investigators from the mainland tracks down a stolen Tiki idol to the Masters' estate where it is on sale as part of a charity auction - but the valued treasure carries a sinister curse. Morgan Fairchild guest stars, with Tom Selleck and Roger E Mosley

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Bodie and Doyle are assigned to prompt Arab cultural attache and assassin Rahad into carrying out a murderous deed, in the hope they can catch him red-handed just before he commits the act and force him out of the country. Comedy actor John Junkin guests stars alongside Martin Shaw and Lewis Collins

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Arthur persuades a reluctant Terry to make a comeback in the boxing ring to take on Jackie Wilson, the opponent he faced prior to losing his licence. However, Wilson's wife soon appears claiming her husband is unable to fight. Vintage comedy drama, starring George Cole and Dennis Waterman

programme.title: Giant Lobster Hunters
programme.desc: Skipper Bryce fishes in his mate's hunting ground in a final sink-or-swim play to turn his fortunes around. Elsewhere, Squizzy faces a massive bill to fix his boat, while the Jager Brothers up the ante with a dingy challenge that backfires

programme.title: World of Sport
programme.desc: Richard Henwood takes a look back at The Indoor League. A show featuring 1970s pub games, presented by Yorkshire cricketing great Fred Trueman.

programme.title: Cycling: Criterium du Dauphine Highlights
programme.desc: Action from stage two, featuring a 167.5km route from Brassac-les-Mines to La Chaise-Dieu. Gary Imlach presents, with commentary from Ned Boulting and David Millar, and reports from Daniel Friebe

programme.title: Isle of Man TT

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: In the heart of Central America lurks a marine creature believed to reach 8ft in length and weigh up to 300lbs. Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is taken to breaking point as he re-evaluates everything he knows about fishing in an attempt to catch this monster - which is known to leap into boats and cause fatal injuries

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: On the Canada-US border lies a vast lake that hides a dark history. For Native Americans it's an ancient and sacred site, but recently something has risen up from the depths to attack swimmers, and stories abound of an invasion of primordial bloodsuckers. Extreme angler Jeremy Wade plunges into the heart of a waterfall in the Pacific Northwest on a mission to catch the oldest river monster of his career

programme.title: Isle of Man TT

Comedy drama, starring George Cole and Dennis Waterman

programme.desc: Our mystery-solving gang is in Chicago investigating the haunting of a historic hot dog factory when they team up with famous competitive eater Joey Chestnut who's in town for the annual hot dog eating competition! Joey joins the gang in uncovering the truth behind a horrible old tree monster that's terrorizing the hot dog factory and threatening to get the competition shut down. Shut down the hot dog eating contest?! Even Shaggy and Scooby can get behind solving this mystery! Especially since Shaggy and Scooby have teamed up with Joey to help him get ready for one of the biggest eating bouts of his career. But if they can't solve the mystery not only won't there be a contest... there just might not be anything left of our gang! Not to mention no more hot dogs! No more hot dogs?! Say it ain't so Joey Chestnut. Say it ain't so.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo and Guess Who?
programme.desc: When Scooby Doo and the gang are on the trail of a monstrous gargoyle in the nighttime city of Paris they're stumped and need help solving the mystery. Velma turns to a close friend that's in Paris for work. It's none other than famous fashion model Gigi Hadid! Velma and Gigi studied Criminal Psychology together and Velma was always impressed with how great Gigi is at picking up clues. Gigi happily joins our gang to get to the bottom of this mysterious gargoyle and what it's really after in the City of Lights. Clues lead to forged paintings and an art theft in the Louvre and the destruction of Paris Fashion Week by the gargoyle! Gigi must orchestrate getting our gang to strut their modeling stuff on the runway in order to save Fashion Week rescue priceless art solve the mystery and give the world its newest modeling sensation Scoobert Scooby Doo.

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil catch up with Steph and Mark who, in 2011, asked for their help to find a property they could live together and eventually have children in. Phil helped them find a project property with three bedrooms for nearly 40,000 under their budget. Today, they are still in the property which looks now looks very different. In 2020, Kirstie and Phil met Elliot and James who were looking to find a home they could share with four bedrooms and an open plan entertaining space in London. After a struggle with the budget, Kirstie found the pair a property, now Phil is back to find out what they have done with the space

programme.title: Extraordinary Escapes with Sandi Toksvig
programme.desc: Sandi is joined by Eddie Izzard on an Irish adventure as they visit three holiday hideaways in Counties Clare, Kerry and Cork and bond over homemade apple crumble. Their first stop in County Clare is a miniature modern marvel called Teeroneer, a timber-clad, prize-winning property with a sunken kitchen that Sandi just can't resist cooking in. From there the pair head to Ark Ranch Treehouse. Hand-built by one woman, Sandi and Eddie are charmed by the sense of childhood adventure they feel. Finally, they head to Lost Cottage in the mountains and lakes of County Kerry. A classic fusion of old and new, the remote rental gives the pair an excuse for Sandi to take Eddie on her very first fishing trip

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: Dispatches follows four pensioners through winter as they struggle to make ends meet with the exceedingly high price of energy and soaring inflation. John, 76, lives alone in Sunderland in the home he used to share with his parents and siblings and spends his nights sat in darkness, afraid his energy bills are too high to turn the lights on. Sixty eight-year-old Doreen has had only two visitors in the 38 years she has lived in her home and goes to bed early to stay warm. In rural Leicestershire, 82-year-old Harry and his wife 77-year-old Christine skip dinner as a desperate attempt at cutting costs

programme.title: Married to a Psychopath
programme.desc: Part one of two. The story of the hunt for murderer Malcolm Webster, who targeted wealthy women for their money. The programme explores the crimes from the perspective of detective Charles Henry, who was behind the three-year investigation to re-open a cold case. He would later be joined by 20 colleagues, who gathered more than 1,000 witness statements and used 90 search warrants for banks, building societies and solicitors

programme.title: A Paedophile in My Family: Surviving Dad
programme.desc: Documentary following a successful businesswoman who carries the weight of a childhood of repeated sexual abuse by her father. With his release from prison, Emily considers confronting the person who dominated her childhood as she seeks to find out if the time inside has changed him at all. She reaches out to those from her formative years - teachers, family friends, and her mother, trying to understand how her abuse remained and reconnects with the police officers who dealt with her case, hidden for so long

programme.title: Nobody's Fool (2018)
programme.desc: The recently paroled Tanya suspects her high-flying sister Danica is in an online relationship with a man who may not be what he seems. Eventually Danica, her friend Kalli and Tanya attempt to get to the bottom of the mystery. Writer/director Tyler Perry's romantic comedy, starring Tiffany Haddish, Tika Sumpter and Whoopi Goldberg

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell

Western adventure, with John Payne, Faith Domergue and Slim Pickens

programme.desc: An unassuming English professor working on an archaeological dig in Germany leads a double life helping enemies of the Nazi regime escape the country. Second World War adventure based on The Scarlet Pimpernel, directed by and starring Leslie Howard, with Francis L Sullivan, Mary Morris, Hugh McDermott, Raymond Huntley and Manning Whiley

programme.title: Night Passage (1957)
programme.desc: The black sheep of a family falls in with a gang of outlaws plotting to rob a train operated by his strait-laced brother, but reckons without his sibling's determination to track him down and set him back on the straight and narrow. Western, starring James Stewart, Audie Murphy, Dan Duryea and Brandon de Wilde

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 3 (2017)

programme.title: Ferris Bueller's Day Off (1986)

programme.title: Bad Teacher (2011)
programme.desc: Cynical, hard-drinking teacher Elizabeth Halsey hates her job and the kids in her class, and hopes to escape her daily grind by landing a rich husband. programme.desc: Two close friends find their hedonistic relationship threatened by impending nuptials. Director Sophie Hyde's comedy, adapted by Emma Jane Unsworth from her semi-autobiographical novel, starring Holliday Grainger and Alia Shawkat

programme.desc: An English widow decides to fulfil her cattle farmer husband's final wish of introducing the Hereford breed to America. Romantic comedy Western, starring Maureen O'Hara and James Stewart

programme.title: The Court-Martial of Billy Mitchell (1955)
programme.desc: In the 1920s, an American colonel accuses the war department of criminal negligence for denying the air force the funding it needs - but the powers-that-be still regard aircraft as an irrelevant part of the military, and respond by putting him on trial. Courtroom drama, starring Gary Cooper and Rod Steiger, with Ralph Bellamy and Elizabeth Montgomery

programme.title: Father Brown (1954)
programme.desc: When works of art start disappearing, stolen by a master thief, Father Brown attempts to catch the culprit and save his soul. Comedy drama, starring Alec Guinness, Joan Greenwood and Peter Finch

programme.title: Captain Scarlett (1953)
programme.desc: A brave nobleman forms a band of outlaws to free 19th-century French villagers from the tyranny of an evil duke, reclaim his birthright and save a lovely princess from a fate worse than death at the hands of a lecherous count. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Richard Greene, Leonora Amar, Nedrick Young and Manolo Fabregas

programme.title: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets (2017)
programme.desc: When a dark force threatens a vast metropolis, special operatives Valerian and Laureline must race to identify the menace and protect the future of the universe. Luc Besson's epic sci-fi adventure, starring Dane DeHaan, Cara Delevingne and Clive Owen

programme.title: Military Wives (2019)
programme.desc: With their partners away serving in Afghanistan, a group of women on the home front form a choir and quickly find themselves at the centre of a media sensation and global movement. As unexpected bonds of friendship flourish, music and laughter transform their lives, helping them to overcome their fears for their loved ones in combat. Comedy drama, starring Kristin Scott Thomas, Sharon Horgan and Emma Lowndes

programme.title: Baywatch (2017)
programme.desc: A veteran lifeguard commands a highly trained team that keeps the sun-kissed resort of Emerald Bay safe. As he breaks in some new recruits - including an insubordinate former Olympic swimmer - he has to contend with a dangerous new drug sweeping the beach. Action comedy based on the TV series, starring Dwayne Johnson, Zac Efron, Alexandra Daddario and Priyanka Chopra

programme.title: Meatballs (1979)
programme.desc: A summer camp leader's trainee staff drive him up the wall with their endless mischief-making, prompting him to knock them all into shape for an imminent sporting contest. Director Ivan Reitman's comedy, starring Bill Murray, Harvey Atkin, Kate Lynch and Russ Banham

programme.title: Shenandoah (1965)
programme.desc: A Virginian farmer is left to raise seven children after his wife dies. He tries to keep his family out of the American Civil War, but when Union troops abduct his son, and his son-in-law enlists with the Confederates, he is unable to maintain his neutral stance and is dragged into the conflict. Western, starring James Stewart, Doug McClure, Rosemary Forsyth, Katharine Ross and Patrick Wayne

programme.title: Sink the Bismarck! (1960)
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama, charting the mission to track down and eliminate the pride of the German fleet, a fearsome battleship devastating British vessels in the North Atlantic, orchestrated by a British naval officer recovering from his wife's death in an air raid. Starring Kenneth More, Dana Wynter, Laurence Naismith and Karel Stepanek

programme.title: Cat Ballou (1965)
programme.desc: A schoolteacher returns to her home town to find a ruthless railroad developer is trying to snatch her family's land. When her father is murdered by a hitman for refusing to sell his ranch, she resolves to defend the property, enlisting the aid of two small-time crooks and a drunken gunslinger with an equally inebriated horse. Musical comedy Western, starring Jane Fonda and Lee Marvin, with music by Nat King Cole and Stubby Kaye

programme.title: The Tin Star (1957)
programme.desc: A world-weary bounty hunter, formerly a sheriff, arrives in a small town where a newly-appointed lawman is struggling to keep the peace. Anthony Mann's Western, starring Henry Fonda, Anthony Perkins, Lee Van Cleef, Betsy Palmer and Michel Ray

programme.desc: Colonel Katherine Powell's mission to wipe out a terrorist cell in Kenya is complicated when a girl enters the blast radius of the intended drone strike. Action thriller, with Channing Tatum, Jamie Foxx, Maggie Gyllenhaal and James Woods

Starring an Oscar-winning Charlize Theron alongside Christina Ricci, Bruce Dern and Scott Wilson

A gay man living with AIDS returns to his North Texan home to spend Christmas with his religious, conservative family, headed by his ex-military father, to whom he remains closeted. Drama, starring Cory Michael Smith and Michael Chiklis

programme.desc: Howard's fear of commitment causes him to avoid Bernadette, but he soon realises he has made a mistake and tries to compensate for it. programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: The arrival of an eco-conscious new neighbour who owns a pet rooster, disrupts the community, leading a desperate Dave and Calvin to team up on a covert mission to restore order

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin and Dave embark on their first road trip together to a classic car show, only to hit an unexpected roadblock that tests their friendship

programme.title: Modern Family

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Halloween is Claire's favourite holiday, but this year she is snowed under at work, so she allows Phil to take over the house-decorating duties - a decision she soon comes to regret. programme.title: Young Sheldon

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is upset to learn Penny is dating someone, so his friends encourage him to seek a new romance by asking another woman out. Sara Gilbert appears alongside her Rosen co-star Johnny Gale

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon stumbles upon a major scientific breakthrough, causing him to feel like a fraud, while Penny steps up her game with Leonard after seeing Howard make a romantic gesture to Bernadette. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is hurt when Professor Proton (Bob Newark) contacts Leonard for help, so he befriends TV scientist Bill Nye, and Raj gets jealous when Howard crashes a girls' night in making home-made jewellery. Starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki, and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Below Deck Sailing Yacht

Hailing from Manchester, Josh was a class act with the lads at his all-boys school but always failed when it came to chatting up women. He hopes that the Naked Attraction experience can find him the perfect partner. Next is 28-year-old performer Jack from London. As a gay divorcee, Jack's love life has definitely hit some low notes, but he's decided now it's on with the show

programme.title: Impractical Jokers

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: Some of the most memorable TV moments from March 2018, including Sport Relief, Top Gear, Bodyguard, Come Home and Great Indian Railway Journeys, get a grilling from the armchair critics

programme.desc: Divorcee Jane wants to find a suitable partner for her son Bobby, and also a new romantic interest for herself, while maths teacher Paul's love of logic and equations is lost on financial advisor Sophie. programme.title: Naked Attraction

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Gemma wants another baby, but Dave worries she has forgotten how difficult a newborn is, so he enlists a robotic doll and Marty's engineering skills to remind her

programme.title: The Neighborhood

programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Teresa, who was born in Portugal but moved to the UK when she was five years old, find a holiday home in the Algarve to reconnect with her heritage

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A family from Derbyshire aim high with an eco-friendly glampsite, plans for a Spanish adventure golf course hit problems and a family launch a new farming business in Portugal

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items in Gloucestershire, including a rare pre-Second World War exercise bike and a huge set of farmyard scales used to weigh potatoes

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Brighton to meet recycler Cat, who has tons of junk in a series of sea containers. Henry salvages a children's scooter, while Simon constructs the largest corkscrew that valuer Ronnie has ever seen

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Probate detectives unravel a mystery involving multiple surnames in a treasury case begun several years previously when a chance conversation with another family member uncovers a daughter and connects two estranged family members for the first time. Plus, the memorial service for a Liverpool MP leads probate detectives to a family who arrived in the city from Ireland at the turn of the 20th century

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate detectives try to find the family of a reclusive printer, and in north London a team unlock the story of a sailor who stopped at nothing to fight for his country

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Newton House in Knaresborough, North Yorkshire, where Denise Carter and Jackie Fennell's traditional B&B focuses on organic, free-range breakfasts. Over dinner, guest Marianne Cammack and Deina Thomas from dominate the conversation, riling up some of the others, while Mike Hayes and Neal Widdowson think the morning meal is all way too fancy

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to the Highlands Pub in Blackpool, where managers Mike Hayes and Neal Widdowson are all about value for money. However, Sean and Kathryn are horrified by what they find in their room, while Marianne and Deina think that theirs needs the female touch. In the afternoon the group competes in a basketball challenge at the amusement arcades, where the quiet hosts come out of their shells

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the White House in Brighton for the third day of the competition, where hosts Sean Edlin and Kathryn Turnbull run a laid-back seaside B&B. Denise and Jackie think the rooms are not well equipped and Marianne finds them clinical, while Mike and Neal are unsure about the price. Tensions are temporarily alleviated by a visit to the famous Theatre Royal, but Marianne and Deina continue to cause trouble at dinner. In the morning, a locally sourced breakfast impresses some of the guests, but the group must decide whether they are getting value for money

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Wakes Hall Lodges near Colchester is the fourth and final visit of the week, where Neal and Mike are wowed by the five-star self-catering accommodation, complete with hot tubs and lakeside views. The others aren't so sure about the 'luxury' breakfast hamper, however, especially as it means cooking their own. An afternoon of dog agility gives manager Marianne Cammack the chance to demonstrate her authority, although over dinner, her domineering conversation causes Jackie to finally snap

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. Mike and Neal from the Highlands Pub challenge the comments that they were considered dirty and lacking in facilities, while Sean and Kathryn from the White House are left smarting after suffering large underpayments for what they think are minor issues. Eventually, the winner is finally revealed

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Fresh from the success of hosting a three-day wedding at the chateau, Dick and Angel make business plans for the grounds, intending to charge people to fish in the moat and forage in the woods. Angel starts work on a second guest suite, but also wants to install an elevator, which pushes Dick's engineering skills to the limit

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Poodle cross Wally is struggling to find a forever home, having spent a year in the centre during which time he has had four unsuccessful attempts. But the staff remain confident someone will come along who is able to handle his tricky behaviour. Meanwhile, bichon frise Bruce is looking for a quiet home and a comfy lap. Will he find that with Janet from Sheffield, who wants a well-behaved dog to keep her company after the death of her husband?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Architect Patrick Bradley has come up with an unusual 100,000 house design built out of four 45ft shipping containers, welded together to form a giant cross and cantilevered over the top of a stream on the family farm in Co Derry. His mother is hoping the new home will help her son find a girlfriend, but the small budget and tight schedule soon pose problems. Kevin McCloud follows his progress

programme.title: Car S.O.S.

programme.title: How to Build

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics

In the Peaks, medics land on top of a steep ridge to rescue Donna, who has collapsed while walking. A motorcyclist collides with a car trying to avoid ducks crossing the road and medics fear multiple fractures

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Cameras follow Aydigul, 38, who has suspected sepsis following major abdominal surgery. programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Gloucestershire, to meet Tom who is obsessed with motocross. Henry upcycles two Porsche wheel rims into a cool pair of stools

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit Sussex to meet Bill and Annie, who have a penchant for Star Wars collectables and most importantly, as far as Henry is concerned, motorbikes

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The team investigates a substantial referral case of a former accountant, but as they examine his family history, a mystery surrounding his parentage slows down research. Meanwhile, in Norfolk, the Heir Hunters look at the case of an unusual village character, who died tragically in a house fire with thousands of pounds hidden in his house

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The case of a family of glovemakers who plied their trade in Yeovil and how the chance discovery of a war grave in a Thai cemetery leads to an emotional realisation

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The latest competition begins at No 33 Hunstanton in Norfolk, where owner Janie Thompson and housekeeper Gemma Layfield hope their quirky design and high-end brand of luxury will win the day. Despite the decor, the in-room bath receives a soggy reception from Cheryle and Anthony Katz, owners of The Lansdowne in the Cotswolds. An afternoon of painting sees Mark and Jan Rummery from The Ivybridge in Goodwick, Wales, emerge as the ones to beat and the group's banter begins. At dinner, father-and-son duo Mick and Chris Emanuele from La Tavola Calda in Nuneaton reveal that they're B&B old-timers and their Italian roots pique interest

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to La Tavola Calda in Nuneaton, where father-and-son team Mick and Chris Emanuele run a basic B&B above their Italian restaurant. On arrival, Mark and Jan are horrified by the standard of decor. That evening, Mick and Chris reveal their George Michael tribute act will be performing after dinner. Janie and Gemma love the experience, but the noise in the rooms keeps Jan awake

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Lansdowne in the Cotswolds, where hosts Cheryle and Anthony Katz hope their hospitality expertise will charm their way to the top. Although the rooms are a hit for Janie and Gemma, Mick and Chris are determined to find fault. Mark and Jan reveal a competitive streak during an afternoon of husky racing, and come dinner Anthony and Cheryle have their business credentials scrutinised

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to the Ivybridge Hotel and Spa in Fishguard Bay, Pembrokeshire, where Mark and Jan Rummery have brought their hospitality experience in Asia to Wales. On arrival, Cheryle and Anthony are unimpressed to be housed in an annexe, and Mick and Chris dismiss the bathroom as a bodge job. During an afternoon of Chinese cookery, the tensions are palpable as relationships continue to disintegrate

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau

However, around half of the 45 rooms are yet to receive adequate attention, the couple's fledgling events business demands attention, and the outbuildings are still in need of conversion

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Dick gets to work on the walled garden in the spring and buys a mini tractor for the job - but it may not fit through the gate. Angel designs another suite, with black walls and mosaic mirrors, and decorates the entire dining room with blossoms so a guest can make a special wedding proposal. The couple also consider the possibility of truffle farming

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary following the staff of Woodgreen animal charity, who are committed to matching their homeless dogs with prospective owners. An eight-stone Newfoundland makes a favourable first impression on the Coxon family, but staff are worried that his habit of showering everyone with a spray of slobber may take some of the gloss off. programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Natasha Cargill wants to build a home shaped like two enormous periscopes in rural Norfolk, but to obtain planning permission, she has to ensure not only that the materials are sustainable, but also agree to measure the transportation used to deliver them. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo falls into line with the University of Glasgow's Officer Training Corps, where he joins students for drill. The political pundit then heads west along the Firth of Clyde to Helensburgh, where he discovers a pioneering group of artists known as the Glasgow Boys. The idyllic West Highland Line takes Michael deep into the Highlands to Inveraray and the ancestral home of the Clan Campbell and Dukes of Argyll. Michael's final stop is Connel Ferry, near Oban, where, on the Achnacloich Estate, he discovers a Highland calf whose breed has become an icon of the Highlands

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the Bolton steeplejack's love of restoring engines and chimneys, highlighting one of his greatest triumphs - the steam traction engine he painstakingly repaired over 27 years. His great appreciation for volunteers who dedicated their lives to preserving the past is also explored

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into the steeplejack's love of steam-powered engines and machinery. After spending a large part of his life studying their construction and history, he passed on this knowledge in his programmes and highlighted the importance of steam power in Britain's past

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo uses his 1913 copy of Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide to venture beyond Europe as he travels through the Holy Land. He begins in Israel, learning about the Baha'i faith and how it spread to Britain in the Edwardian era, hearing the story of the origins of Tel Aviv, and visiting the Christian, Jewish and Muslim quarters of the capital Jerusalem. Michael then crosses the separation barrier between Jerusalem and the West Bank in the company of his Palestinian guide and meets the embroiderers of the Arab Women's Union in Bethlehem, before finishing his journey in the Negev desert

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits a soup factory in Wigan that produces 2.5 million cans a day, and follows the production of a tin of vegetable soup from a pea harvest to the eventual dispatch. He also encounters a pressure cooker that stands 27.4 metres tall. Cherry Healey compares the vitamin content of fresh and frozen vegetables, and visits a salt mine in Crewe, while historian Ruth Goodman cooks up a butterted spinach soup using a recipe from a 17th-century cookbook, which is the earliest known reference to soup in English

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Japan
programme.desc: The actress flies over Tokyo in a helicopter. The city was bombed extensively during the Second World War, so almost all of it is a symbol of the post-war economic boom that saw Japan become the world's second largest economy. While in the capital, Joanna heads out to a nightclub to see a Japanese girl band and witnesses the largely male audience perform almost as much as the artists on stage. Later, Joanna travels to the Kiso Valley to walk the Nakasendo Way, an ancient route that once linked Tokyo to Kyoto, a place best known for that most famous of Japanese traditions, the Geisha

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's World of Steam, Steel and Stone

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his trusty 1913 Bradshaw's Continental Railway Guide, Michael Portillo travels east through the Balkans along the most exotic section of the route taken by the Orient Express. His journey begins in Sofia, capital of Bulgaria, and includes stops in the ancient city of Plovdiv, the region of Rumelia, and former capital of the Ottoman Empire Edirne. Arriving in Istanbul, Michael takes a trip on the Bosphorus - a much-coveted stretch of water - finds out about Turkish delight and travels along the Marmaray metro line, which connects European and Asian Istanbul via a tunnel beneath the Bosphorus

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo enjoys a ukulele lesson in Haddington, East Lothian, birthplace of the Victorian self-improvement guru Samuel Smiles. In Musselburgh, he gets a taste of life as a fishwife, before exploring Edinburgh where a popular 19th-century mode of transport is making a comeback. Michael also visits the Royal College of Surgeons, where he discovers the macabre history of body snatchers and murderers and heads onwards to the University of Edinburgh Medical School, to learn how students use sophisticated technology to study anatomy

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Roberta Smithies from the Lake District in Cumbria hopes to wave goodbye to her childhood home and embrace a new life in Costa Rica. She has a budget of 200,000 and hopes Jonnie Irwin will find her a property with views that are impressive enough to tempt her to make an offer

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps Nicholas and Pauline Patch, a couple who have frequently holidayed on Fuerteventura in the Canary Islands and are now looking for a second home there. Armed with a budget of 125,000, she shows them around a range of potential properties

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Country Lives
programme.desc: Gary and Annette plan their dream country home, while Dannie and Grace research activities for another new learning zone on their family farm

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway
programme.desc: Complete strangers paramedic Sarah and garment technologist Paige team up to transform a crumbling house bought at auction into a dream home. The tired Victorian terrace in Stafford, the West Midlands, is packed with original features and, armed with a budget, a six-month schedule and advice from Simon O'Brien, they seem the perfect team. But with money leaking like water from a broken pipe, will there be enough left to make a profit?

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole finds a miniature Hay Wain to lovingly restore as he and Simon O'Brien head to Suffolk and Constable Country

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: This competition takes place in Essex and Suffolk, where the first host, 29-year-old entrepreneur Chris, plans to treat his guests - Samantha, Joanna, Mark and Claire - to a night of fine French cuisine, with the added bonus of ripped abs on display

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second night from Essex/Suffolk, and it is the turn of salon owner Sam to cook. She has opted for a good looking, simple menu, but foodie Chris is not impressed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Claire hosts the third night of the contest in Essex, and lays on a lavish East End-themed feast, but Sam may be looking for vengeance after everyone claimed her food was boring

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Day four in Essex sees Polish party girl Joanna offer a taste of her homeland in a bid to win the prize. But some of the unusual flavour combinations throw her guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final dinner party in Suffolk is hosted by anti-social behaviour officer Rachel, who hopes to win over her guests with an evening of comfort food and a few tricks up her sleeve. She hates to lose, but will need to curb her comments towards the other guests and let her dishes do the talking if she wants to be in with a chance of beating joint leaders Holly and Jonalt

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Kim is looking for a holiday home on Spain's eastern Costa del Sol and she's brought her younger sister Debbie along to help. Both Kim and Debbie grew up by the sea in south Wales, so they desperately want their holiday home to be within a stone's throw of a beach. Leah Charles-King shows them what their 115,000 can get as she lines up five properties for them to visit

programme.title: Ancient Egypt by Train with Alice Roberts
programme.desc: The historian takes a train journey across the world's oldest and greatest civilisation, starting at the very end of the Ancient Egyptian empire in Alexandria, before heading south to Cairo, Luxor and Aswan. Alice goes deep underground in search of Cleopatra, discovers how the Romans and the Greeks reacted to the treasures of Ancient Egypt and, on a visit to the site of the Lighthouse of Alexandria, she learns how a slave became a sultan and built his own fairy-tale caste

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Liam, 31, is rushed to St George's after collapsing at home after his fourth epileptic seizure of the day, and he experiences another at the hospital, while 89-year-old Mair is brought to A&E with severe chest pain and difficulty breathing and doctors take blood samples to test whether her symptoms are due to pneumonia. Twelve-year-old Lauren arrives by ambulance after breaking her leg while scoring a try in a rugby match and she needs extensive surgery to give her the best chance of walking normally again

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on what they have been watching during the week, with cameras capturing their instant reactions and the lively discussions that are prompted by the week's biggest and best shows

programme.title: Taskmaster

In Inverclyde, nine-year-old David has been thrown 50 yards off his quad bike and impaled onto a metal fence, while 59-year-old Jacqui is rushed to the Queen Elizabeth Major Trauma Centre with multiple injuries after her car fell 10 feet down an embankment

programme.title: A Paedophile in My Family: Surviving Dad
programme.desc: Documentary following a successful businesswoman who carries the weight of a childhood of repeated sexual abuse by her father. With his release from prison, Emily considers confronting the person who dominated her childhood as she seeks to find out if the time inside has changed him at all. She reaches out to those from her formative years - teachers, family friends, and her mother, trying to understand how her abuse remained and reconnects with the police officers who dealt with her case, hidden for so long

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a woman who feels like she's going to pass out at work. As the paramedics arrive, they find her lying on the floor. A man needs morphine to combat the agony of kidney stones. A patient suffering with a painful hernia needs an operation, but due to the Covid-19 pandemic it's been postponed and now he's being constantly sick and can hardly move

programme.title: Four in a Bed

Later, in the morning, there's a long wait at breakfast

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Country Lives

programme.title: The Great House Giveaway

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first dinner party in Bristol is hosted by theatre-lover Richard Hope-Hawkins, whose eclectic menu divides the guests even before they arrive. Teacher Laura Ford is impressed by the sound of home-made pate, and food writer Darryl Bullock is intrigued by the Rod Steiger gunge cake. However, vegetarian Zoe Kellaway is not looking forward to her alternative starter of red and green pepper mousse, while stonemason Andy Wright thinks the dishes have a feminine touch

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Primary school teacher Laura Ford hosts the second dinner in Bristol, and prides herself on throwing a highly organised party, meticulously planning every detail of the event. Her menu features a starter of prawn, chorizo and butternut squash salad, followed by a Balinese curry, and a trio of desserts

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third dinner party in Bristol is hosted by food critic Darryl Bullock. A self-confessed animal lover, he hopes his pork belly roast will impress, but does not count on his pets leaving an unpleasant surprise for two of the guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Botox fan Zoe Kellaway hosts a 'pretty in pink' dinner party for the penultimate evening in Bristol. She hopes to cheer up the group by cooking a predominantly pink menu, which features beetroot risotto, and enlists the help of a butler in hot pants to serve cocktails

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Stonemason Andy Wright hosts the final dinner party in Bristol, confident the black-tie theme and his impressive Victorian flat will win him the 1,000 prize. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Retired teachers Carrie and Steve are looking for their dream property in the town of Islantilla on Spain's Costa de la Luz. With a budget of 110,000, they're after a two-bedroom apartment as close to the beach as possible, where they hope to while away the winters. Leah Charles-King lines up five properties for the pair to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc: Sarah and Graham turn their attention to the transformation of their sitting room. But as well as building their dream house, they have 220 acres of farmland to think about and having tickled their tastebuds with cider last year, Graham buys four apple trees. It may not be an orchard, but it's a start

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line

Michael Bay's action thriller, starring Will Smith, Martin Lawrence, Tea Leoni, Tcheky Karyo and Theresa Randle

programme.desc: In an effort to remind Rachel and Ross of their former happiness together, Joey and Phoebe set them up with their worst possible blind dates, while baby Emma causes problems for Monica and Chandler's love life. Guest starring Jon Lovitz

programme.desc: Ant Horsley is one of a team of officers pursuing a car suspected of being linked to the drugs trade, and a high-speed and hazardous chase ensues across the Peak District. programme.title: Police Interceptors

programme.desc: Everyone except Ross pools their money to buy lottery tickets, but a disagreement about how to spend any winnings prompts a disdainful Phoebe to make a rash gesture. programme.title: Traffic Cops

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Eden confides in Cash that she doesn't want to share their love song with Lyrik because it's personal to them. Mali can tell Mackenzie is not coping and offers his support

Crime drama, starring Mariska Hargitay

programme.title: Motorway Patrol
programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. The series focuses on Auckland, the country's largest urban area, and features motoring chaos including major traffic collisions, escaped animals and pedestrians on busy roads. programme.title: V.
programme.desc: Drama inspired by the classic 1983 mini-series about man's first encounter with an extraterrestrial race, updated and reimagined for a 21st-century audience. The Visitors - or Vs - have arrived, simultaneously appearing in every major city in the world to promote a message of peace, share their knowledge of technology and their view that all races should be united. For some of the humans, the Visitors prove a huge fascination, but many others are suspicious of their motives and believe they are planning to take over the planet by stealth. programme.title: Pocket Dragon Adventures
programme.desc: A group of very small dragons live with a kindly old wizard, they're not big enough to fly but that doesn't stop them having many adventures

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: A ceremony is held to honour the new Golden Dragon - but Ang goes missing

programme.title: Roswell Conspiracies
programme.desc: The story of allied intelligence agents who've discovered aliens on Earth who are bent on taking over the world. In response, the agents form a top-secret multinational agency, The Global Alliance.

programme.title: Extreme Dinosaurs
programme.desc: 65 Million years ago, Dinosaurs disappeared. Now they're Back! T-Bone, Spike, Bullzeye, and Stegz. Four prehistoric dinosaurs, evolved into intelligent beings reawaken in a bizarre new world

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times.

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times.

programme.title: Kong: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Kong, Jason, jungle girl Lua, fun-loving Tann and wise Dr. Jenkins take on power-hungry scientists, ferocious prehistoric creatures and incredible magical beings to protect their unique island home

programme.title: Department S
programme.desc: The team investigate why two gunmen should have visited the morgue to shoot the corpse of a man resembling a notorious criminal who allegedly died three years previously

programme.title: The World's Most Incredible Hotels
programme.desc: The most extraordinary, iconic, and luxurious hotels ever built, taking in 26 destinations across 18 countries

programme.title: The Six Queens of Henry VIII
programme.desc: Profile of the king's six wives, all formidable individuals. Ambitious, brave and ruthless, they shaped the King, and in turn, England itself

programme.title: Monkey
programme.desc: The pilgrims hatch a cunning plan to liberate the land of Codslow, ruled over by three evil immortals who depend on pearls, paper and wine to fuel their magical powers. Cult adventure, starring Masoaki Sakai

programme.title: San Demetrio London
programme.desc: The story of a British merchant ship in an Atlantic convoy in 1940 that was left disabled and at the mercy of patrolling U-boats. The crew must keep afloat and out of harm's way

programme.title: Lilies of the Field (1963)
programme.desc: Travelling handyman Homer Smith stops at a remote farm in the Arizona desert to get water when his car overheats, and encounter a group of German, Austrian and Hungarian. He agrees to repair a roof for them, but the mother superior has a bigger task in store for him. starring an Oscar-winning Sidney Poitier, with Francesca Jarvis, Lisa Mann and Isa Crino

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: The Moonbase is attacked by strong electric waves from a mysterious nearby planet, so the Alphans resolve to convince its residents they pose no threat. Sci-fi drama, starring Martin Landau, Barbara Bain and Nick Tate

programme.title: London Live News
programme.desc: News weather events and the best of the capital's culture. Join us to explore life in London.

programme.title: Otters and the Exotic Pet Trade
programme.desc: Tracking the exotic pet trade of otters across the globe, is a story of gangsters and guns, mammals and middlemen

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: The first episode of the classic 1970s comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter as a middle-aged executive stuck in a rut and eager to learn the real meaning of life. When Reginald Perrin set out for work on Tuesday morning, he had no intention of calling his mother-in-law a hippopotamus. But he did, and from then on everything began to change. Originally broadcast in 1976

programme.title: Big City Life
programme.desc: Documentary following a group of West Ham FC fans who have formed friendships by wearing colourful shirts when they support their team in the stands

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Nicola accepts an invitation to debate with her shadow Peter Mannion on Richard Bacon's late-night Radio 5 Live programme. However, breaking news changes the whole agenda, ruining both PR teams' well-made plans, and as the airwaves are opened up to listeners, spin doctors converge on the studios. Political comedy, with Rebecca Front and guest star Roger Allam (Ashes to Ashes)

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Munroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: Quest Boxing League
programme.desc: Welcome to the UK's toughest boxing competition, where aspiring young boxers battle it out inside the ring for their chance to be crowned the Quest Boxing League Champion

programme.title: Spaced Out (1979)
programme.desc: Four friends stumble across a crashed spaceship, which is crewed by three female aliens and their robot sidekick. The extraterrestrials force the humans to help them repair their vessel, but get distracted by their first close encounter with men. Sci-fi comedy, starring Barry Stokes and Tony Maiden

programme.title: Orthodox (2015)
programme.desc: An Orthodox Jewish boy is bullied for his faith, and learns to box so he can fight back. When he pursues a career in the ring as an adult, it leaves him ostracised from his community. Desperate to support his family, he turns to crime, setting in motion a terrible chain of events that leave him more isolated than ever. Drama, starring Stephen Graham and Michael Smiley

programme.title: An Englishman in New York
programme.desc: John Hurt reprises his role as Quentin Crisp in this sequel to The Naked Civil Servant, picking up his story where the 1975 drama about the eccentric Englishman left off. Crisp sets off on the journey of a lifetime to the Big Apple, where the Americans immediately embrace the openly gay writer and his waspish ways, and before long he is being wined and dined by celebrities in every corner of Manhattan. But, as is so often the case with Quentin, he cannot resist making outrageous comments, and an ill-considered quip about the growing Aids crisis sees him suddenly dropped from high society. Sex and the City's Cynthia Nixon co-stars as performance artist Penny Arcade, with Jonathan Tucker, Denis O'Hare and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: The Thick of It
programme.desc: Nicola accepts an invitation to debate with her shadow Peter Mannion on Richard Bacon's late-night Radio 5 Live programme. However, breaking news changes the whole agenda, ruining both PR teams' well-made plans, and as the airwaves are opened up to listeners, spin doctors converge on the studios. Political comedy, with Rebecca Front and guest star Roger Allam (Ashes to Ashes)

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: Music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's most acclaimed choirs featuring regular guest artists

programme.title: Department S

programme.title: Serving the Royals
programme.desc: Personal stories of the royal household's servants, including consultants, advisers and protectors of the House of Windsor

programme.title: The Six Queens of Henry VIII
programme.desc: Profile of the king's six wives, all formidable individuals. Ambitious, brave and ruthless, they shaped the King, and in turn, England itself

programme.title: The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin
programme.desc: The first episode of the classic 1970s comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter as a middle-aged executive stuck in a rut and eager to learn the real meaning of life. When Reginald Perrin set out for work on Tuesday morning, he had no intention of calling his mother-in-law a hippopotamus. But he did, and from then on everything began to change. Originally broadcast in 1976

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Monroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: A Child Is Waiting (1963)
programme.desc: A pair of volunteer workers selflessly devote themselves to working at a school for mentally disabled children, but clash over the best approach to teaching an autistic boy neglected by his parents. John Cassavetes' drama, with Burt Lancaster, Judy Garland, Gena Rowlands, Steven Hill and Paul Stewart

programme.title: Paris Blues (1961)
programme.desc: Two talented blues musicians attempt to make their mark on the Parisian music scene - but complications get in the way as they encounter a bevy of beautiful fans. Romantic drama, starring Paul Newman, Joanne Woodward, Sidney Poitier and Louis Armstrong

programme.title: Plane Crash Recreated
programme.desc: First-hand accounts of the disaster that befell United Airlines Flight 232, which was making its way from Denver to Chicago in 1989 when the DC-10 aircraft suffered a catastrophic failure to the tail-engine

programme.title: William and Mary
programme.desc: Tragedy strikes on Mary's last day at work before her maternity leave when an old friend commits suicide - and she reluctantly decides to call off the wedding. Meanwhile, William plans the funeral of a kindly churchwarden, and is shocked to discover the deceased belonged to a society of cross-dressers. Martin Clunes and Julie Graham star

programme.title: The Spy Who Fell to Earth
programme.desc: An incredible true story of international espionage following the life and death of Egyptian billionaire and double agent Ashraf Marwan

Thriller, starring Ryan O'Neal, Bruce Dern, Isabelle Adjani, Ronee Blakley and Matt Clark

programme.title: Song for a Raggy Boy (2003)
programme.desc: A widower is hired to teach at a strict Catholic reformatory school, but the harsh regime soon fires his anger, leading to a series of confrontations with the heavy-handed priests in charge of the establishment. Fact-based drama set in 1939, starring Aidan Quinn, Iain Glen, Marc Warren and Dudley Sutton

programme.desc: Six train robbers hide from the law in a deserted monastery off the Cornish coast, where disguising themselves as monks proves the perfect way of lying low while carrying on with various criminal activities. Comedy, with Ronald Fraser, Barbara Windsor, Bernard Cribbins, Wilfrid Brambell and Davy Kaye

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present an education-themed edition, quizzing small-screen teachers both fictional and real. They are Grange Hill headmistress Gwyneth Powell - who teams up with singer and former GH pupil Michelle Gayle - Waterloo Road couple Philip Martin Brown and Melanie Hill, Steve Speirs, who stars in David Walliams' sitcom Big School and The Demon Headmaster himself, actor Terrence Hardiman. These actors compete against each other as well as Jonny Mitchell and Mike Steer, the headteacher and deputy headteacher of Thornhill Community Academy, the school featured in Channel 4's fly-on-the wall documentary Educating Yorkshire
